title: New Birthday Gifts causing me to not be able to play league
body: I got a ASUS Monitor 22 inches and when i try to run league no matter on  how low settings are it will overheat and shut down, theres no dust in the fans and i dont know what to do, help plox?

replies.body:
There's a lot of information here. Let's break this down a bit. Are you running a laptop or a desktop? Also, did you notice these issues only after starting to use your 22" monitor? Also does the shutting down happen in a match or while the client is just sitting idle?

With a bit more info, we can work together to resolve this for good.

I'm running a laptop with the laptops original screen disabled, the issues started after using my 22" and the shutting down happens in match only, client is fine and everything else is fine just ingame

Can you disconnect the 22" display and re-enable the laptop's display to see if you still experience this? Also, what indication were you getting that this is caused by overheating that resulted in the shutdown?

When I disconnect it and re-enable it dosn't experience it, and it shutdown because the computer was getting really hot around the fan, alot hotter than normal. also my brother who's pretty experienced with this stuff said so

Gotcha. It sounds like your graphics card could be having a hard time powering the external display because it may require more power than what it takes to run your built-in display. I recommend reaching out to our tech team in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can have you run some tests to see why this is happening.

If you run a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), it will expedite your service. Let me know if you have any questions.
i found a solution to fixing it, i had to unplug my battery and lower the maximum processor state to 99%

also for my PC and Display specs ill post them in this message:
